en.organization_text: The third edition of CTWC Iberia, second held in person after 2022, was a qualitative leap thanks to the participation of Movistar as a partner of the event, which allowed us to have the facilities of the central Telef√≥nica building located in the heart of Gran V√≠a in Madrid.
en.auditorium_text: In this incomparable setting we were able to enjoy the attendance of players from all over Europe, and we could even see the best Tetris projected on the stairs of the building.
en.stairs_photo_text: Entrance stairs of the Telef√≥nica store in Madrid
en.qualifying_phase_text: The whole event took place in the second-floor auditorium, customized to reflect the best atmosphere of classic Tetris. In the morning we held the qualifiers, and in the afternoon, the playoffs! Both were streamed live on Twitch and commented on by a variety of community members.
en.streaming_details_text: Gunter, Elpailtem, TBricks, Retrocabeza, Vachetbeasty and, of course, the tireless TomelloSoulman, present almost at all times in the broadcast, responsible for the technical preparation of the rendering system with which the tournament was visualized and the wonderful configurations of Nestrischamps for the championship production.
en.streaming_details_photo_two_text: Focus view on Vachetbeasty with the rest of the players on screen
en.knockout_phase_text: During the morning, the clock was the protagonist. Three time slots, of about 50 minutes each, would be the ones that would mark the final position in the standings table for the participants. While the aspirants played their games and set their records, Yelena and Berni were in charge of verifying that each of the classification results were correct and that they had been recorded. The highlight in this phase was to see how Luis was the only player in the tournament who managed to score some maxouts. Specifically, 5. After a little more than three hours we decided to stop for lunch and rest a little. The best was yet to come and we had to regain strength.
en.winner_text: Having recovered our energies, we reached the most important phase of the championship. We had 15 players in a single elimination competition, with Luis advancing directly to the quarterfinals. Deewee emerged as the champion, while Luis secured an outstanding second place for the second consecutive year.
en.community_reception_text: The reception from the community, both those attending the live event and those following the tournament online, was incredibly enthusiastic, confirming that things were done well and this is the way forward. Enjoy the highlights video, and see you next year!
